page.title: Physiology Overview
page.introduction: The Physiology contains the description of the biological components that comprise a BioModel:

list.item: Reaction Diagram is a graphical editor used to create and edit structures, reactions and species.
Reactions provides a table to view, create and edit reactions and reaction rules.
Structures provides a table to view and edit membrane and volume compartments.
Species provides a table to view and edit species defined within structures; molecular details of species can also be edited here.
Molecules provides a table to view and define molecules, the building blocks for rule-based models.
Observables provides a table to view and define observables, the outputs of rule-based models.

appearance.para: Properties for components of a BioModel can be found in the Object Properties pane in the bottom right pane.
